page.title: 15Cecil Ward/Memories/Blaby
page.content: Cecil Ward,born Auburn Rd Dec 23 1905. Marriage register, Parish Church shows his forefathers came to Blaby 1589. At 5 years he attended Blaby Church School Infants. Head,-Mrs Ridgeway.He then attended the junior school near the church.The Head,Mr Atkins always came to school in frock-coat and silk hat.At 13 Mr Ward went to work in a silk factory (now gone)in Park Road. Work started, 6.30am.Breakfast,8.30 to 9am.One hour midday for lunch,work ending at 6.30pm.Saturdays work was 6.30-12.30pm.Not one factory in 1985 is still doing its original work.In Mr Ward's youth many employed 150-200 people,now most employ only a few.{Mr {Ward remembers}:Folk swam in the canal in summer.Aug 3,1914 a plane landed in Blaby, the first to be seen. Blaby station burning down.1915 Kitchener's army stopped for a night in Blaby.
